DPH206 2020 Handbook Methods for Analysing Public Health IV: Working in the Field: Data Dr. Lei HAN, Dr. Peng ZHAO 2020-02-16 1 W1: Course review and preparation 1.1 Basic Information DPH 206 introduces students to the fieldwork in public health and provides the opportunity to conduct and analyse their own research data. Students will learn principles of data management and presentation, conduct of qualitative and quantitative studies, data analysis, how to recognize and control bias, and ethical issues in the conduct of research. 1.2 Key Module Information Module name: Methods for Analysing Public Health IV: Working in the Field: Data Module code: DPH 206 Credit value: 5 Semester in which the module is taught: Semester s Pre-requisites needed for the module: DPH 205 Programs on which the module is shared: BSc Public Health 1.3 Delivery Schedule 2020.02.24 – 2020.04.06: Lecture room: Online teaching Lecture time: tbd. Preferred means of contact: email 1.4 What you can expect from the module 1.4.1 Educational Aims of the Module This course aims to provide the student with a basic understanding of methods and issues involved with collecting, analysing, and presenting data. 1.4.2 Learning Outcomes Employ basic public health research. Demonstrate the use of core public health research principles in the field. Appropriately examine and interpret research findings. Appraise findings and formulate the conclusions of this research. 1.4.3 Assessment Details The assessment is composed of assignments (8) (40% of total mark), presentation (10%), and final report (50%). Specific assignments will be provided to students after the moderation process begins. 1.4.4 Methods of Learning and Teaching The course will be delivered through a series of lectures, seminars, case study presentations, and group work. The students will be required to participate in seminars through presentation and discussion. Students are expected to spend an adequate amount of time in private independent study and are expected to have read relevant materials before class. 1.4.5 Syllabus & Teaching Plan No. Week Lecture Seminar(Students’ presentations) 1 O1 - Course Review- Preparation of required materials - Reproducible reports 2 O2 - Sampling designs- Data collection - Types of Data Sets- Ethics in data collection - Study designs from published papers 3 O3 - Scientific Plotting - Data visualization of students’ own datasets 4 O4 - GIS - Maps 5 O5 - Time series - Time series 6 O6 - Hypotheses- Research Plan- Mindmap - Research ideas- Research plans 7 W1 - Writing articles- Bibliography management- Equations - Background of a research 8 W2 - Developing questionnaires- Types of interviews Questionnaire 9 W3 - Theses- Slides- Posters Slides and/or posters 10 W4 Collaboration Team work 11 W5 Reproducible research Reproducible documents 12 W6 Research Website Personal/project website 13 W7 Project Management Scientific project 1.4.6 Essential Textbooks # bib Show in New WindowClear OutputExpand/Collapse Output Guest, Greg and Emily E Namey (2014).
